metadata.Title: CVE-2021-31154 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
pleaseedit in please before 0.4 uses predictable temporary filenames in/tmp and the target directory. This allows a local attacker to gain fullroot privileges by staging a symlink attack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-31154` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

pleaser - 0.4.1-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: rust-pleaser package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.4.1-1').
